Package de.lessvoid.nifty.tools

Class EnumStorage<K extends Enum<K>,V>

java.lang.Object
de.lessvoid.nifty.tools.EnumStorage<K,V>
Type Parameters:
K - the type of the keys, this has to be a enumeration
V - the type of objects used as values, the factory has to generate those
public class EnumStorage<K extends Enum<K>,V> extends Object
This is a special implementation for a enumeration based storage. It stores values in relation to enum keys that are generated by a factory once they are requested. This is handy in case the factory creates carrier objects that are supposed to store data in relation to the enumeration keys.

    • EnumStorage

      public EnumStorage(@Nonnull Class<K> enumClass, @Nonnull Factory<V> factory)
      Create a new instance of this storage.
      Parameters:
      enumClass - the class of the enumeration that is used to provide the keys
      factory - the factory instance that creates the values

  • Method Details

    • isSet

      public boolean isSet(@Nonnull K key)
      Check if a specific entry of the storage was used already.

      In case this is false the value assigned to the key was never requested.

      Parameters:
      key - the key
      Returns:
      true in case the key is assigned to a value

    • get

      @Nonnull public V get(@Nonnull K key)
      Get the value assigned to the specific key.
      Parameters:
      key - the key
      Returns:
      the value assigned to the key, this value is newly created upon the first request
